main event: On 17 August 1953, military personnel observed an unidentified flying object over South-Central France.
interesting points: The object was described as bright metallic in appearance with intermittent bursts of light,The sighting was made by experienced pilots, Captain Walter J. Cotter and 1st Lt. Thomas M. Falvey, who considered the observation reliable,The flying object reportedly climbed at an altitude of 26,500 feet and accelerated to an estimated speed of 660 to 725 mph,The sighting lasted for approximately 15 minutes before the object disappeared from view,The incident remains unresolved within the Project Blue Book records.
witness description: Experienced pilots from the 55th Fighter Bomber Squadron
